org.minijson.builder.policy

Interface BuilderPolicy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBuilderPolicy, DefaultBuilderPolicy

    public interface BuilderPolicy
    A "strategy" for JSON building options. Note that this option should be consistently used within a module or even within an app. This option determines how an object is serialized to json. If you use different policies from type to type (or, even object to object), your app's serialization behavior might appear rather inconsistent.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int drillDownDepth()
      Depth below a bean/map/list behavior.
      int escapeForwardSlash()
      Forward slash need not generally be escaped (except for "

      Whether to read bean attrs (getXXX()).

    • Method Detail

      • drillDownDepth

        int drillDownDepth()
        Depth below a bean/map/list behavior. it applies to a bean/map/list's children of types {map, list, bean}. depth==1 means use introspection down to this object (attr->value) only, or, top-level map/list only, etc. if useBeanIntrospection() == false, we only drill down for map and list. Special value: -1 means no limit in drilling down. (note that the drill down might end up infinite, e.g., due to cyclic object dependencies, etc. --> therefore, the implementation should put a hard limit.)

      • useBeanIntrospection

        boolean useBeanIntrospection()
        Whether to read bean attrs (getXXX()).

      • escapeForwardSlash

        int escapeForwardSlash()
        Forward slash need not generally be escaped (except for "
